title: HOTEL BOOKING APPLICATION
description: Built a full-stack hotel booking app (TypeScript, Node, Express, MongoDB, Tailwind). Features: auth, hotel management, image uploads, search, and payments.
problem: Independent hotels lack the resources to build and maintain a comprehensive online booking system, making it difficult to compete with larger chains.
solution: Developed a full-stack MERN application providing hotels with a dashboard to manage bookings, room inventory, and pricing. The customer-facing side features secure payments, advanced search filters, and an intuitive booking process.
impact: The platform empowers small hotel owners to increase their online visibility, streamline operations, and boost direct bookings, reducing reliance on third-party booking sites and their high commission fees.

title: QUANTUM MACHINE LEARNING
description: Hybrid quantum/classical ML experiment using Qiskit and PCA to compare performance with classical baselines.
problem: Classical ML sometimes struggles with certain small-data, high-dimensional tasks where quantum feature spaces may offer advantages.
solution: Built a hybrid pipeline (Qiskit + classical preprocessing) using PCA and parameterized quantum circuits to evaluate model performance against classical baselines.
impact: Provided empirical benchmarks and insights on where quantum embeddings could be beneficial; clarified next steps for larger-scale experiments.

title: SURVEILLANCE VIDEO ANOMALY DETECTION
description: Built a surveillance video anomaly detection pipeline (TensorFlow, OpenCV) with a CNN detecting multiple anomaly types and optimized frame extraction for performance.
problem: Detecting rare anomalous events in long video streams with limited compute and high false-positive rates.
solution: Engineered an efficient frame-extraction pipeline + lightweight CNN classifier, plus post-processing to reduce spurious alerts.
impact: Lowered false positives and improved processing throughput, enabling near-real-time anomaly signalling on edge hardware.

title: DISEASE PREDICTION SYSTEM
description: Disease prediction tool using Multinomial Naive Bayes (scikit-learn) with a simple Tkinter GUI.
problem: Clinicians and students need quick, interpretable prototypes to explore symptom-to-diagnosis models without heavy tooling.
solution: Built a lightweight Multinomial Naive Bayes model with a simple Tkinter UI for input and immediate predictions; focused on interpretability.
impact: Serves as a teaching/prototyping tool that demonstrates model behavior and helps prioritize data collection for production-ready systems.

title: FOOD ORDERING APPLICATION
description: Full-stack food ordering app with a restaurant dashboard and customer-facing ordering UI.
problem: Small restaurants need affordable online ordering and simple order management without complex integrations.
solution: Implemented a MERN stack app with a restaurant dashboard, menu management, and customer ordering flow.
impact: Reduced order friction in demos and prototypes; provided a foundation for production-ready features like payments and analytics.

title: CRYPTO CURRENCY CLASSIFIER
description: ML classifier trained to categorize cryptocurrencies from feature data.
problem: Automatically labeling and categorizing cryptocurrency addresses from noisy feature sets is challenging at scale.
solution: Trained classifiers on engineered features to reliably categorize addresses and evaluate performance across classes.
impact: Improved automated labeling accuracy and provided a reproducible pipeline for further feature engineering and model iteration.
